author: Joseph De Avila
title: New Jersey Drops Investments in Some Gun Makers
text:
New Jersey sold off its investments in gun manufacturers that make automatic and semiautomatic weapons for civilian use, state officials said Thursday.
The state Department of the Treasury dumped its investments in gun makers after reviewing risks to New Jersey’s pension fund following the February school shooting in Parkland, Fla., that claimed the lives of 17 people.
“After... RELATED VIDEO Can Gun Makers Be Held Liable for Mass Shootings? Could Remington Outdoor, the maker of the AR-15 style rifle used in the Sandy Hook shooting, be held responsible for the deaths of children killed there? Parents of the victims are using a 1977 lawsuit about a slingshot to argue that they are liable. WSJ’s Spencer Macnaughton explains. Photo: AP To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
